title: All Quiet on the Western Front
description: A young soldier faces profound disillusionment in the soul-destroying horror of World War I.

title: The Blue Angel
description: An unworldly professor falls in love with a cabaret singer and becomes the humorless clown in her show.

title: Animal Crackers
description: Mayhem ensues when Captain Spaulding, the African explorer, attends a society party to unveil a valuable painting.

title: Hell's Angels
description: Brothers Monte and Ray leave Oxford to join the Royal Flying Corps. Ray loves Helen; Helen loves Monte; but Monte loves a blonde named Jean.

title: Morocco
description: A cabaret singer and a Legionnaire fall in love, but their relationship is complicated by the appearance of a wealthy man who wants her for himself.

title: The Big House
description: A drunk-driving conviction lands a man in an overcrowded prison where he gets caught in the middle of a planned inmate riot.

title: Anna Christie
description: A former prostitute falls in love, but has difficulty escaping her past.

title: The Divorcee
description: After discovering her husband has been unfaithful, a wife decides to beat him at his own game.

title: Min and Bill
description: A waterfront innkeeper protects her adopted daughter from her biological mother and truant officers.

title: Murder!
description: A juror in a murder case, convinced that the accused woman is innocent, sets out to find the real killer.

title: City Girl
description: A farmer's son travels to the city and falls in love with a waitress, but his father disapproves of the match.

title: Earth
description: The process of collectivization and the hostility of kulak landowners is depicted through the eyes of Ukrainian farmers.

title: L'Age d'Or
description: A surrealist tale of a man and a woman who are passionately in love, but their attempts to consummate that passion are constantly thwarted by their families, the Church, and bourgeois society.

title: The Big Trail
description: Breck Coleman leads a wagon train of pioneers through Indian attack, storms, deserts, swollen rivers, down cliffs and over the Rockies.

title: Holiday
description: A man from a humble background falls in love with a girl from a rich family, but finds he has more in common with her free-spirited sister.

title: Ladies of Leisure
description: A 'party girl' falls in love with a wealthy aspiring painter, but his family disapproves of her background.

title: The Dawn Patrol
description: The commander of a WWI flight squadron in France fights with his superiors over the heavy casualties his men are suffering.

title: King of Jazz
description: A spectacular revue featuring Paul Whiteman and his Orchestra, noted for its early use of Technicolor and animation.

title: Whoopee!
description: A hypochondriac helps a young woman elope to the West to escape an arranged marriage.

title: Abraham Lincoln
description: A biography of the 16th president, from his early days in a log cabin to his presidency during the Civil War.

title: Just Imagine
description: In the futuristic year of 1980, people have numbers instead of names and the state arranges marriages, complicating the lives of young lovers.

title: Madam Satan
description: To win back her husband, a woman disguises herself as a mysterious devil-woman at a masquerade ball held on a zeppelin.

title: Monte Carlo
description: A countess runs away from her wedding to Monte Carlo, where she falls for a count posing as a hairdresser.

title: Tom Sawyer
description: The adventures of a mischievous boy and his friend Huckleberry Finn on the Mississippi River.

title: Journey's End
description: British officers cope with the stress and horror of trench warfare during World War I.

title: Romance
description: A young clergyman falls in love with an Italian opera star, despite the objections of his family and the church.

title: Sarah and Son
description: A woman spends years searching for the son who was taken from her by her husband and sold to a wealthy family.

title: Outward Bound
description: Passengers on a strange ocean liner slowly realize that they are all dead and are being transported to the afterlife.

title: The Criminal Code
description: A district attorney who is tough on crime becomes the warden of a prison filled with men he convicted, including a young man imprisoned for a crime of self-defense.

title: Billy the Kid
description: The legendary outlaw Billy the Kid seeks revenge for the murder of his employer in the Lincoln County War.

title: Feet First
description: An ambitious shoe salesman pretends to be a wealthy tycoon to impress a girl, leading to a perilous adventure on the side of a skyscraper.

title: Westfront 1918
description: Four German infantrymen on the Western Front during the last months of World War I experience the terror and futility of war.

title: Under the Roofs of Paris
description: A street singer and a gangster fight for the attention of a pretty young woman in Paris.

title: The Blood of a Poet
description: A surrealist film exploring the plight of the artist and the forces of inspiration and obsession.

title: Raffles
description: A gentleman jewel thief falls in love and decides to give up his life of crime, but one last job beckons.

title: Paid
description: A woman wrongly imprisoned seeks revenge on the men who framed her by marrying the son of one of them.

title: Street of Chance
description: Based on the life of gambler Arnold Rothstein, a high-stakes gambler tries to keep his younger brother from following in his footsteps.

title: The Green Goddess
description: Three British citizens crash-land in a small kingdom in the Himalayas, where they are held hostage by the local Rajah.

title: Paramount on Parade
description: An all-star variety revue featuring Paramount's biggest stars performing comedy skits and musical numbers.

title: Sin Takes a Holiday
description: A plain secretary marries her boss in a marriage of convenience, then goes to Paris and transforms herself into a glamorous woman.

title: The Bat Whispers
description: A mysterious criminal known as 'The Bat' terrorizes the guests at a country estate. Notable for its early widescreen cinematography.

title: With Byrd at the South Pole
description: A documentary record of Rear Admiral Richard E. Byrd's first expedition to the South Pole.

title: Danger Lights
description: A railroad boss tries to help a down-and-out engineer, but they become rivals for the same woman. Shot in a pioneering widescreen process.

title: Kismet
description: A wily beggar in ancient Baghdad schemes to get his daughter married to the Caliph while dealing with the evil Wazir.

title: The Vagabond King
description: In 15th-century Paris, the poet Francois Villon rallies the common people to fight for King Louis XI against the Duke of Burgundy.

title: The Rogue Song
description: A Russian bandit chief falls in love with a princess, but their romance is threatened when he kills her brother for raping his sister. (Partially lost film).

title: Laughter
description: A former Follies girl marries a wealthy older man but finds herself bored and tempted by her former love, a struggling composer.

title: The Royal Family of Broadway
description: A parody of the Barrymore theatrical family, focusing on the eccentricities of a famous acting clan.

title: Manslaughter
description: A spoiled rich girl accidentally kills a motorcycle policeman and is prosecuted by the man she loves.

title: Borderline
description: An experimental silent film dealing with issues of race and sexuality in a small village, focusing on an interracial love affair.
